have announced their intentions to offer a special promotion for internet connectivity to households of MCSD students and staff who do not already have a subscription and reside within the service areas of these providers.

br.em: Click on the logo/links below for more information from internet service providers.

​Click For COVID-19
Our Mission
The Montrose and Olathe School District will ensure that all students have a safe and academically rigorous environment in which to learn. All students entering into our high schools will graduate with life skills and knowledge required to enter into the workforce, begin a career, attend college or other post-secondary education opportunities of their choice, without remediation.
PBL Suggestion Box & Volunteer Sign Up

div.div: 930 Colorado Avenue; PO Box 10,000, Montrose, CO 81402 | Phone 970-249-7726 | Fax 970-249-7173

Notice of Non-Discrimination Montrose County School District RE-1J does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age or disability in hiring or employment practices, admission to its programs, services or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district’s activities and programs. ​Questions, complaints, or requests for additional information regarding these laws may be forwarded to the designated compliance officer: District Compliance/Michelle Pottorff 930 Colorado Avenue; P.O. Box 10,000, Montrose, CO 81402 (970) 249-7726 michelle.pottorff@mcsd.org or directly to the U.S. Department of Education, Office for Civil Rights, Region VIII, Federal Office Building 1244 North Speer Blvd., Suite #310, Denver, CO 80204.
